subject: Protectable
msgSnippet: Hello, In jUnit framework, there is a class called Protectable. What is the purpose of this class? I know that TestResult use a subclass of Protectable to
messageBody:
Hello,

In jUnit framework, there is a class called Protectable. What is the
purpose of this class? I know that TestResult use a subclass of
Protectable to execute the runBare method of the
TestCase:

protected void run(final TestCase test) {
startTest(test);
Protectable p= new Protectable() {
public void protect() throws Throwable {
test.runBare();
}
};
runProtected(test, p);

endTest(test);
}
public void runProtected(final Test test, Protectable p) {
try {
p.protect();
}
catch (AssertionFailedError e) {
addFailure(test, e);
}
catch (ThreadDeath e) { // don't catch ThreadDeath by accident
throw e;
}
catch (Throwable e) {
addError(test, e);
}
}

But why not just execute runBare directly like this:

protected void run(final TestCase test) {
startTest(test);
try {
test.runBare();
}
catch (AssertionFailedError e) {
addFailure(test, e);
}
catch (ThreadDeath e) { // don't catch ThreadDeath by accident
throw e;
}
catch (Throwable e) {
addError(test, e);
}
endTest(test);
}

Sorry, maybe I miss a very obvious answer. I am still learning Java and I
find jUnit a great subject to study.

--
Endy Tjahjono
